meanings.definition: To affirm to be true or genuine
meanings.sent1: I can attest that the sun rises in the east every morning.
meanings.sent2: The witness will attest to the defendant's innocence in court.
meanings.sent3: The talking parrot can attest to the fact that it is indeed a clever bird.
meanings.sent4: The blooming flowers attest to the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent5: The old lighthouse attests to the history of this coastal town.

meanings.definition: To give proof or evidence of
meanings.sent1: The fingerprints on the weapon attest to the suspect's presence at the crime scene.
meanings.sent2: The official documents will attest to the company's financial stability.
meanings.sent3: The overflowing trash cans attest to the lack of proper waste management.
meanings.sent4: The roaring applause from the audience attests to the performer's talent.
meanings.sent5: The rainbow after the storm attests to the beauty of nature's resilience.

meanings.sent1: The ancient ruins attest to the civilization that once thrived in this area.
meanings.sent2: The scars on his body attest to the hardships he has endured.
meanings.sent3: The loud cheers from the crowd attest to the excitement of the game.
meanings.sent4: The empty playground attests to the children's absence during winter break.
meanings.sent5: The old photographs attest to the memories shared by generations.
